description: Erection of a three storey rear extension; two roof lights and new door to front and two roof lights to rear; conversion of upper floors into three residential units
decision_conditions: The proposed three storey rear addition, by reason of its size, positioning and design would be harmful to the living conditions of residents of neighbouring properties by reason of its overbearing effect and subsequent loss of light, privacy and outlook; contrary to Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policies B5 and H33, Replacement UDP Policies 4.1 and 5.5. | The proposed conversion would represent an undesirable overdevelopment of the site which would result in a cramped development harmful to the living conditions of existing and future occupants of the site and in the locality, contrary to Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policies B1, B5 and H26, Replacement UDP Policies 4.1 and 5.9. | The addition of a second entrance in the front elevation of this building is considered to be out of keeping with the established pattern of shopfronts evident in this area, and would thus be harmful to the street scene, contrary to Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policy B1, Replacement UDP Policy 4.1.
